name: 2000s TV
description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

key_work.title: 2000 Australian TV miniature
key_work.credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
key_work.brief_description: This gorgeous miniature model celebrates memorable moments from the 2000s.

constellations_primary.name: 2000s TV
constellations_primary.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

start.title: Kath & Kim
start.brief_description: Kath & Kim is a character-driven Australian television situation comedy series. The series was created by, and is written by Jane Turner and Gina Riley who play the title characters: a suburban mother and daughter with a dysfunctional relationship.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

end.title: East West 101
end.brief_description: Zane Malik and the Major Crime Squad investigate crime and murder in all quarters of multicultural Sydney.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

links.description: Kath & Kim followed a mother and daughter combo as they negotiated life in middle-class Melbourne. The year it ended, East West 101 began airing on SBS and presented a clash of cultures based on real police cases in Sydney.

start.title: East West 101
start.brief_description: Zane Malik and the Major Crime Squad investigate crime and murder in all quarters of multicultural Sydney.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

end.title: Underbelly
end.brief_description: Underbelly is an Australian television true crime-drama series, each series is a stand alone story based on real-life events.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

links.description: East West 101was an extremely influential police drama for its inclusivity. Starring Don Hany and Aaron Fa’aoso, it was based on the real-life experiences of Sydney detectives. Similarly Underbelly became a massive hit for channel Nine, with all seasons based on notorious crime cases.

start.title: Underbelly
start.brief_description: Underbelly is an Australian television true crime-drama series, each series is a stand alone story based on real-life events.

end.title: Packed to the Rafters
end.brief_description: Packed to the Rafters is an Australian family-oriented television series which premiered on the Seven Network on Tuesday 26 August 2008 at 8:30 pm.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

links.description: With its first season focusing on Melbourne’s gangland wars, Underbelly has been one of Australia’s enduring crime shows with the anthology series switching up the setting, characters and crimes per season.

start.title: Packed to the Rafters
start.brief_description: Packed to the Rafters is an Australian family-oriented television series which premiered on the Seven Network on Tuesday 26 August 2008 at 8:30 pm.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

end.title: H2O: Just Add Water
end.brief_description: H2O: Just Add Water revolves around three teenage girls facing everyday teen problems with an added twist: they cope with the burden of growing a giant fin and transforming into mermaids whenever they come in contact with water.

end.title: The Secret Life of Us
end.brief_description: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

end.title: Kath & Kim
end.brief_description: Kath & Kim is a character-driven Australian television situation comedy series. The series was created by, and is written by Jane Turner and Gina Riley who play the title characters: a suburban mother and daughter with a dysfunctional relationship.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

links.description: With Y2K in the rear view, it was time for for something noice, different, unusual. Enter Full Frontal alumni Gina Riley and Jane Turner’s hugely popular Kath & Kim, a cross between the mockumentary and sitcom formats.
